_header: Ye that will hear of wit [Ȝhe that welyie here of wytte]
Note: For MSS which lack the Prologue see 5269.
Subjects: utilitarian verse; moon, changes of; lucky and unlucky days
_description: The ‘Storia Lune’ — 116 6-line stanzas, with a Prologue of seven stanzas

BodDou84.First Lines:
ȝhe þat welyie here of wytteþat is wytnessyd of holy
                    wryte…
BodDou84.Last Lines:
…þat we mow thurw hys mercy dereIn heuen to haue a place
                    Amwn

CamStJohn237.First Lines:
…What dremys bene in alle manereAnd othere þenggys
                    mo…
CamStJohn237.Last Lines:
…Þat we mow þorow hys mercy dedeIn heuene haue a
                    place
